parameterProperties.description: Required. The title of the check run.
parameterProperties.name: title

parameterProperties.description: Required. The summary of the check run. This parameter supports Markdown.
parameterProperties.name: summary

parameterProperties.description: The details of the check run. This parameter supports Markdown.
parameterProperties.name: text

parameterProperties.description: Adds information from your analysis to specific lines of code. Annotations are visible on GitHub in the Checks and Files changed tab of the pull request. The Checks API limits the number of annotations to a maximum of 50 per API request. To create more than 50 annotations, you have to make multiple requests to the Update a check run endpoint. Each time you update the check run, annotations are appended to the list of annotations that already exist for the check run. For details about how you can view annotations on GitHub, see "About status checks". See the annotations object description for details about how to use this parameter.
parameterProperties.name: annotations

parameterProperties.description: Adds images to the output displayed in the GitHub pull request UI. See the images object description for details.
parameterProperties.name: images

parameterProperties.description: Required. The path of the file to add an annotation to. For example, assets/css/main.css.
parameterProperties.name: path

parameterProperties.description: Required. The start line of the annotation.
parameterProperties.name: start_line

parameterProperties.description: Required. The end line of the annotation.
parameterProperties.name: end_line

parameterProperties.description: The start column of the annotation. Annotations only support start_column and end_column on the same line. Omit this parameter if start_line and end_line have different values.
parameterProperties.name: start_column

parameterProperties.description: The end column of the annotation. Annotations only support start_column and end_column on the same line. Omit this parameter if start_line and end_line have different values.
parameterProperties.name: end_column

parameterProperties.description: Required. The level of the annotation. Can be one of notice, warning, or failure.
parameterProperties.name: annotation_level

parameterProperties.description: Required. A short description of the feedback for these lines of code. The maximum size is 64 KB.
parameterProperties.name: message

parameterProperties.description: The title that represents the annotation. The maximum size is 255 characters.
parameterProperties.name: title

parameterProperties.description: Details about this annotation. The maximum size is 64 KB.
parameterProperties.name: raw_details

parameterProperties.description: Required. The alternative text for the image.
parameterProperties.name: alt

parameterProperties.description: Required. The full URL of the image.
parameterProperties.name: image_url

parameterProperties.description: A short image description.
parameterProperties.name: caption

parameterProperties.description: Required. The text to be displayed on a button in the web UI. The maximum size is 20 characters.
parameterProperties.name: label

parameterProperties.description: Required. A short explanation of what this action would do. The maximum size is 40 characters.
parameterProperties.name: description

parameterProperties.description: Required. A reference for the action on the integrator's system. The maximum size is 20 characters.
parameterProperties.name: identifier

parameters.description:
This API is under preview and subject to change.

See preview notice.
parameters.name: accept

parameters.description: Required. The name of the check. For example, "code-coverage".
parameters.name: name

parameters.description: Required. The SHA of the commit.
parameters.name: head_sha

parameters.description: The URL of the integrator's site that has the full details of the check. If the integrator does not provide this, then the homepage of the GitHub app is used.
parameters.name: details_url

parameters.description: A reference for the run on the integrator's system.
parameters.name: external_id

parameters.description:
The current status. Can be one of queued, in_progress, or completed.

Default: queued
parameters.name: status

parameters.description: The time that the check run began. This is a timestamp in ISO 8601 format: YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ.
parameters.name: started_at

parameters.description: Required if you provide completed_at or a status of completed. The final conclusion of the check. Can be one of success, failure, neutral, cancelled, skipped, timed_out, or action_required. When the conclusion is action_required, additional details should be provided on the site specified by details_url. Note: Providing conclusion will automatically set the status parameter to completed. Only GitHub can change a check run conclusion to stale.
parameters.name: conclusion

parameters.description: The time the check completed. This is a timestamp in ISO 8601 format: YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ.
parameters.name: completed_at

parameters.description: Check runs can accept a variety of data in the output object, including a title and summary and can optionally provide descriptive details about the run. See the output object description.
parameters.name: output

parameters.description: Displays a button on GitHub that can be clicked to alert your app to do additional tasks. For example, a code linting app can display a button that automatically fixes detected errors. The button created in this object is displayed after the check run completes. When a user clicks the button, GitHub sends the check_run.requested_action webhook to your app. Each action includes a label, identifier and description. A maximum of three actions are accepted. See the actions object description. To learn more about check runs and requested actions, see "Check runs and requested actions." To learn more about check runs and requested actions, see "Check runs and requested actions."
parameters.name: actions

parameterProperties.description: Required. The id of the GitHub App.
parameterProperties.name: app_id

parameterProperties.description: Required. Set to true to enable automatic creation of CheckSuite events upon pushes to the repository, or false to disable them.
parameterProperties.name: setting

parameters.description:
This API is under preview and subject to change.

See preview notice.
parameters.name: accept

parameters.description: Enables or disables automatic creation of CheckSuite events upon pushes to the repository. Enabled by default. See the auto_trigger_checks object description for details.
parameters.name: auto_trigger_checks
